channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024041353
item.description:
Report X-2024041353

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was dropped off at the INDH spill office with signs of a release. The spill agent found two plastic bottles inside packaged inside of plastic bags with a foam pad for dunnage. One of the bottles had a loose cap causing the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024040539
item.description:
Report E-2024040539

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quarts of material released from two (2) 1-gallon metal pails that had been punctured by a sharp object due to improper loading of the freight. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the recovered spent material into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail.

item.title: Report E-2024040538
item.description:
Report E-2024040538

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) quarts of material released from two (2) 1-gallon plastic bottle. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight's team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS ON THE SORT AISLE BELT WHEN THE LEAK WAS DISCOVERED. EMPLOYEE SHUT THE BELT OFF AND NOTIFIED RESPONDER ABOUT THE HAZMAT LEAKING. RESPONDER PUT PPE ON AND RESPONDED TO THE SPILL.

Report X-2024040971

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at QA wet and noticeably damaged with paint on outside of container. Upon further inspection found leaking inner contents due to loose seal. DescribePack: failed at top of can due to poor seal DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: when discovered, package was segregated from other packages
